title: Danniella Westbrook is in the Halloween spirit with devilish outfit
text:
She’ll put a spell on you… (Picture: Backgrid)

Daniella Westbrook is getting in the Halloween spirit a week early.

But then is it ever too early to walk around Liverpool city centre in your underwear and a netted cape?

The former EastEnders actress appeared to be gearing up for All Hallow’s Eve, the night when the veil between the spirit realm and our own realm is at it’s thinnest, with a devilish Halloween outfit.

The 45-year-old wore her black Calvin Klein pants and sports bra and paired it with a net skirt and black net cape.

She accessorised with Maleficent horns and a devil’s fork, which is a unique take on Angelina Jolie’s character, for sure.

is it ever too early to walk around Liverpool city centre in your underwear and a netted cape? (Picture: Backgrid)

Danniella is celebrating 10 months sober, and in September joined friends as she helped launch a new Dayhab addiction centre.

The Big Brother star was supporting the Help Me Stop Centres opening across the UK to give so many more people a more achievable support network to achieve and have a recovery program led by qualified and experienced therapists and specialists in addiction.

It’s a unique take on Angelina Jolie’s character, for sure (Picture: Backgrid)

In July she admitted to The Sun that staying sober is an ongoing effort, but that she is likely to die if she ever takes cocaine again.

The actor, who famously lost her septum after years of cocaine abuse, explained: ‘I won’t recover next time. If I relapse that’s it.

‘I’ve got another relapse in me, but I don’t have another recovery. It’s do or die for me. I know I’m one relapse away from dying.’

Danniella Westbrook found fame on EastEnders (Picture: PA)

Danniella had previously been clean for 12 years until she relapsed in 2014, but is determined to kick the habit for good.

Her problems began at the age of 14, after she had shot to fame in EastEnders, and she claims to have spent over £250,000 on her drug addiction.

She has previously admitted to taking up to five grams of cocaine a day while pregnant with her son Kai, even taking it during labour.

Her botched dental surgery in 2017 also led to a relapse, with her admitting: ‘I was dabbing cocaine around my mouth and rubbing it into numb the pain.

‘I had three operations in seven weeks. I’m an addict and the wheels fell off.’
